subject: [Radiance-general] RAdiance Compile on Redhat Linux 7.1
body:
This message is in MIME format. Since your mail reader does not understand this format, some or all of this message may not be legible. ------_=_NextPart_001_01C139FC.943AA45C Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1" There are Linux binaries available at the distribution site: http://radsite.lbl.gov/radiance/pub/ , though I can't currently reach the site. I didn't have any problems with the compile on Redhat, so I would be curious to know what version you are trying to compile and what the errors are. --thomas -----Original Message----- Sent: Monday, September 10, 2001 3:22 PM To: RADIANCE ONLINE MAILING LIST I'm trying to install Radiance on my machine running Redhat 7.1, and I'm not having any success with it. HAs anyone heard of changes made to the system that might cause compiler errors? It seems to fail with about half of the executable files I expect it to make. I've made the appropriate changes in the makeall file to point to the X11 directories, so I'm fairly confident thats not the problem. Does anyone have and suggestions, or perhaps know where I might find a pre-compiled version for Linux OS? Thanks, Robert Graham ------_=_NextPart_001_01C139FC.943AA45C Content-Type: text/html; charset="iso-8859-1"
There are Linux binaries available at the distribution site: http://radsite.lbl.gov/radiance/pub/, though I can't currently reach the site. I didn't have any problems with the compile on Redhat, so I would be curious to know what version you are trying to compile and what the errors are.
 
--thomas
-----Original Message-----
From: Robert Graham [mailto:rgraham@indiana.edu]
Sent: Monday, September 10, 2001 3:22 PM
To: RADIANCE ONLINE MAILING LIST
Subject: [Radiance-general] RAdiance Compile on Redhat Linux 7.1

I'm trying to install Radiance on my machine running Redhat 7.1, and I'm not having any success with it.  HAs anyone heard of changes made to the system that might cause compiler errors?  It seems to fail with about half of the executable files I expect it to make.  I've made the appropriate changes in the makeall file to point to the X11 directories, so I'm fairly confident thats not the problem.   Does anyone have and suggestions, or perhaps know where I might find a pre-compiled version for Linux OS?
 
Thanks,
 
Robert Graham
------_=_NextPart_001_01C139FC.943AA45C--
